column1: fullish, wide outside off but swinging in slightly. But Shaw rocks back onto the backfoot, and punches a drive through the covers! Back-and-across stuff, rare to see these days
length ball, just outside off, and the ball stays low! Shaw tries to cut, but the ball goes under his blade
length ball on off, and angling into Shaw's body. Stays on the back foot, and taps it back to Bhuvneshwar. Tidy line
length ball on off, and once again angling into middle stump. Shaw shuffles across his stumps, and defends off the back foot towards mid-on

first slip's been removed, and the ball flies through that region! Unlucky Bhuvneshwar. Full outside off, angling in, and Shaw looks to drive straight. Ball takes the outside-edge and runs down to the third-man boundary
fullish just outside off, and he prods forward to drive. Hit to mid-off
full, just outside off, and he takes a big stride forward to defend. Tapped off the front foot, but the shot's been bat-padded towards the leg side
over the wicket, full just outside off, and he works it from outside the stumps to deep midwicket. Good use of the wrists
full, wide outside off from around the wicket. He mistimes a front-foot drive to mid-off for a jogging single
length ball, wide outside off and turning into Shaw. He glances this late to short third man for a single
full on off, and he skips down the wicket to meet the delivery. Nudged off his pads to the midwicket region
length ball on off, but big offspin into leg stump. Clipped off his hips to deep midwicket
length ball, just outside off, and tapped to cover

through him! Tries to swipe across the line, and the ball crashes into off stump. Length ball angling in, and Shaw goes for a very ugly leg-side slog. Ball whizzes under his bat, and sends the youngster back
length ball on off, and the ball angles in. Defended off the back foot
length ball, on off, and he defends off the back foot to mid-off
full on middle, and he taps this with gentle hands to cover. Dhawan wants the single, but intercepted inside the circle
length ball on off, and he walks down the wicket before driving to mid-off
full on off, and turning into his pads. Looks to work it towards the leg side, but the extra bounce hits his body
length ball on middle, and worked off the back foot to midwicket. Nobody there, so they walk across for a single
flatter, full on middle, and Dhawan takes a big stride forward to play the sweep. Struck well, but can't beat backward square
full on middle, but angling down leg. Dhawan tries to flick fine, but the ball hits his boot and rolls down to short fine leg
full just outside off, and tapped with gentle hands to cover. They scamper across for a single
length ball on middle, and turns against the left-hander. He closes the bat's face and works it away to the leg side
back of a length on middle, and angling across Dhawan. Shapes up to cut, but the shot finds the fielder at point
full, outside leg stump, and Dhawan skips down the wicket, before muscling a leg-side swipe to deep midwicket
lofted! What timing. Full on middle, and Iyer clears his front leg before lifting a leg-side shot right over long on! Superb sound off his bat
full, wide outside off, and he shapes up to play the cover drive. Struck well, but can't beat the infield
full, just outside off, and he prods forward to drive. Played to the off side
length ball, on off, and tapped towards point with the bat's open face. They scramble across for a single
overpitched outside off, and he slices an attempted cover drive to the infielders on the off side
full on leg, and Dhawan sweeps this with a lot of power! Played along the ground, past backward square, and the fielder in the deep has no chance
length ball outside off, and turning further away. Dhawan goes onto the back foot, and guides this past short third man
length ball on middle, and Dhawan goes deep into his crease, before clipping it behind square on the leg side
length ball on off, and turning in. Worked away to deep midwicket off the back foot

Dhawan falls off the last delivery of the Powerplay! Tossed up on off, turning away from Dhawan, and his attempted sweep has taken a top-edge. Easiest of catches for short fine leg as the Powerplay comes to an end
fullish, just outside off, and steered off the front foot to short third man for a single

full on middle, and he meets the ball on the front foot. Drives back past the bowler, and very nearly carries to Kaul. Warner, at mid off, slides across the ground to intercept. Stops a certain boundary
length ball, just outside off, and he once again guides this delivery off the back foot to third man for one
length ball on middle, and Pant walks across the line, before working this off his pads to deep square leg
back of a length on off, and he swiftly ducks under the ball's line. Well negated
length ball, just outside off, and Iyer check-drives to long off. Just five off the over from Kaul
full toss, juicy outside off, and Iyer hammers a shot through cover! Wide long-off can't cut it off. Loose delivery
length ball on off, and the wrong'un spins inwards. Iyer makes room to cut, but the ball follows him. Mistimed to point
half-tracker, wide outside off, but straightening after pitching. Tapped off the back foot, straight back to Rashid
what a delivery! Full, just outside off, and Iyer prods forward to drive. Ball whizzes past his outside edge, and Bairstow misses a stumping. The ball wasn't in his gloves
length ball on off, and the googly is worked off the back foot to midwicket. They're going for the dangerous second run, but they're eventually safe
length ball, wide outside off, and turning further away. Cut square to backward point
length ball on leg, and worked off his hips to deep midwicket for a walking single
stump-to-stump bowling. Lands length on off, and he defends off the back foot to mid-on
length ball on middle, and he closes his bat's face to wristily swipe towards deep midwicket. Can't find the boundary though
slower ball, offcutter on middle stump. Iyer takes one hand off the bat's handle, and works it towards the leg side
slower ball again, full outside off, forcing Pant to reach at it. Looks to lift this inside-out over cove, but he doesn't pick the knuckle ball well. Ball stays very low
length ball on middle, and gently tapped into the vacant region near midwicket. Sandeep gives the ball a chase to stop the second run, and does so successfully. Timeout

full outside off, and Pant tries to clear the boundary. Lifts this inside-out over the off side, but Pant hasn't generated enough power. In the air for ages, and Hooda at long-off times his jump perfectly. How often have we seen a wicket first ball after a break. Pant is not happy at all
length ball on middle, and glanced off his hips to short fine leg
length ball on off, and nudged off his pads to backward square for a walking single
full, just outside off, and turning away. Tapped off the front foot to cover
length ball, wide outside off, and he cuts this behind square to backward point

appeal for lbw but not given! Nabi can't believe it. Slider from around the wicket, landing on middle, and going straight through. Skids on, doesn't take anything off the bat, and hits the inside of his front leg. Sunrisers review and replays show that the ball is clipping the outside of leg stump. Tewatia survives, marginally, because that's umpire's call on review
length ball on off, and he prods forward to drive. Through to long-on for a single
diving stop at midwicket. Length ball whipped firmly across the angle but Hooda's right hand sticks out and stop this
shot! Difficult to hit that on a seemingly slow pitch. Length ball just outside off, stands tall and punches through the line to bisect extra cover and mid-off
on the body as he takes the pace off this. Grips in the surface just outside off as he looks to flick and it's deflected to the keeper. Looked to come off the glove

taken at cover! Nabi runs to his right and takes this. Superb bowling this. A knuckle ball, good length and just outside off. Hangs the bat out at it and is completely beaten in pace. Chips it harmlessly into the off side
offcutter, floated full and just outside off. Driven on the front foot, straight to extra cover
length at off stump, gets deep in the crease and glances into the square leg region
short of a length and turning in at off stump. Gets deep in the crease and punches hurriedly to sweeper cover
short and spinning away wide outside off. Reaches out and cuts to sweeper cover
googly at off stump, gets down to play the sweep and is too early on it. Inside edge ontp pad
short of a length on leg stump, whipped to deep square off the back foot
beaten. Legbreak at a length outside off. Leans in and looks to drive. Past the outside edge
short of a length just outside off, looks to chop behind square but this skids low. Under-edge to keeper's left
slower ball at a length on off stump, pushed to point on the rise

handsome! Iyer stands tall and pulls off the front foot. The DC coach will be proud of that. Length ball in the corridor, not a slower one this time and he plants the front leg out to lift this over midwicket
leading edge trickles to short third man. Legcutter at a length on off stump, closes the face too early on it
slower ball, short and wide outside off. Cut to sweeper cover
length just outside off, driven on the up to extra cover
thick outside edge cut off by third man to his right. Short of a length just outside off, looks to slap it behind square off the back foot

run-out chance missed! Manish Pandey throws at the striker's end after swooping down on this at point. Narrowly misses the single stump. Length ball was poked into the off side with soft hands and Ingram wasn't even trying to make his ground there
slower short ball wide outside off, left alone

taken at point! Pandey lunges to his left and plucks a dying ball! Ingram is gone. Big wicket. Slower ball short of a length outside off. Looks to cut and once again can't control that shot. It's sliced and it's falling down on Pandey who leaps to his left and manages to get his fingers under this with both hands
yorker length just outside off, jammed into the covers off the front foot
scythed away! Too short from Kaul. And very wide. On this pitch, that's a front-foot chop begging to be played. Morris gets it past point's left hand
slower ball at a length on middle stump, offers the full face and taps it past the non-striker
length ball wide outside off, looks to sweep but this turns away massively and he's beaten

Rashid gets a review on lbw. He was looking to sweep the length ball again, but was struck on the back leg. Was it outside the line? A slider from Rashid, no turn on it. Back thigh. Looks to me like it's marginally outside off stump...yes, marginal. Just enough to be umpire's call. And it is missing the stumps too. He survives, but does he know what's happening? Doesn't look like it.
beaten on the reverse sweep. Full slider outside off and he can't get the bat down on it
googly, turning into the pad from a length. Deflected towards short fine
boom! Emphatic from Iyer. Length ball just outside off, he's picked this slider and drilled it through the line. Straight and flat over the bowler with a big stride
short and wide outside off, looks to cut and is beaten
length at off stump, steps out and looks to punch. Gets it to deep midwicket off the inside half of the bat
length outside off, drives on the rise to extra cover
short ball outside off, pulls it between long-on and deep midwicket
yorker length at leg stump, looks to back away and drive. Gets a thick inside edge to short fine's left
slower ball at a length on leg stump, flicked to deep backward square
low full toss on middle stump, shuffles and flicks off the toe-end to deep midwicket's left

loses his cool! Just when he'd set up for a big end to a solid innings, Iyer swipes across the line to Rashid. It's not advisable. This comes in from a length outside off and is past the inside edge to hit off stump
full on off stump, gets to the pitch and drives to long-off
short of a length slider outside off, cut to sweeper cover
short of a length just outside off, cut to sweeper cover
length at middle stump, steps out and flicks to long-on
googly from wide of the crease around the wicket. Axar picks it and blocks into the off side
oh lovely ball! Gets the knuckle ball to grip, rise, and more slightly away from off stump as Morris walks down the pitch and looks to flick. Past off stump
bam! Lines up and pumps this over the square leg boundary! Length ball just outside off, steps into the line and swings wholeheartedly
short of a length just outside off, pulled to deep square
slower ball at a length outside off, punched straight to extra cover on the rise
slower ball, short of a length just outside off. Gets low for the late cut and is beaten
slower ball at a length outside off, drags across the line to deep midwicket's left where Pandey is quick and keeps it to one
full at middle stump, gets the front leg out and drives firmly along the floor to long-on
length ball just wide of the marker outside off, left alone

outfoxed him! Such a good defensive strategy from Bhuvneshwar and perfectly executed. A legcutter at a good length, just inside the wide marker. It's the ball Chahal uses too against big-hitters. Morris wants to pump it over extra cover but it's slow and it's off the toe-end of the bat. Nabi pedals a little to his left and holds on
length and wide outside off, can't get the drive past extra cover

dropped at deep square! Sandeep gets under the ball and gets shaky hands to put down a simple chance. Length ball on leg stump. looks for the uppish flick and lobs it straight up. He crouches in the end and possibly loses balance as a result. Should have taken that standing
length at off stump, punched to long-off
brutal. Length ball wide outside off, no pace off this and it sits up nicely for Axar who splits his legs and chucks his hands at it. Goes whistling over extra cover
well bowled. Slower ball, short of a length outside off. He wants to pull this but can't get bat on it
taken at short third man. Offcutter outside off at a good length. Rabada gets on his knee for the slog sweep and gets a top edge. No fuss this time in the field, he's taken
offcutter at a length outside off, shuffles and swings across the line. It skids from under the bat

lovely hit! Length ball at leg stump, gets behind the line and lifts it on the rise. Every time the seamers have gone back to their normal paces, they've been hit. Near impossible to lift one from short of a length like this other wise. But he's done superbly to get it over wide long-on
got good connection on this but Hooda slides to his right and gets his body behind this. Length ball, slower outside off. He stepped out and crashed it on the up

straight over his head! Axar has called Kaul's line, length, and pace, and then he's made full use. Slower ball at a good length outside off. He stepped into it's line and slapped it off the front foot, straight over the sightscreen!
run out? Full on leg, and Warner looks to reverse sweep straight away. Finds Dhawan at first slip, who throws down the stumps. Warner was in though
length ball on off, and the ball holds it's line thereafter. Delivery stays low too, as Warner under-cuts back to the bowler
tossed up on leg, and the googly goes across Warner. Defended with gentle hands off the front foot
length ball on leg, and turning into the batsman's pads. Flicked off his pads to he leg side
full on off, and Bairstow shuffles across the stumps exposing all three wickets. Sweeps along the ground to deep backward square
length ball on middle, and worked off his pads to long on. Tidy start for Sunrisers
full outside off, and defended off the front foot to cover

dropped! Length ball, just outside off, and he skips down the ground to hit the ball. Flat-batted to Axar's left, and he reacts well to get both hands to the ball. But the ball just pops out, and Axar is distraught
length ball on off, and angling in. Backs away, and punches to cover
length ball on middle, and angling into JB. He backs away to pull, but ball stays low. Hits his body
length ball on middle, and he rocks back to tap this back to the bowler. Five dots
length ball, just outside off, and he mistimes a cut to cover point. They scamper across for a single
tees off! Full on middle, and Bairstow exposes all three stumps, before airlifting a straight drive over the bowler's head. Stand and deliver!
full, wide outside off, and the attempted leg-side slog comes off the bat's toe end. Finds the gap between deep midwicket and long-on
full on off, and the googly is dragged to deep midwicket. Another slog attempted
full on leg, and turning into Warner's body. The attempted straight drive is sliced past cover. Iyer gives the ball a chase

full outside leg stump, and the googly hits Warner as he tries to sweep. Question is whether it's pitching outside leg stump, but Sandeep has convinced Iyer. Pant said 'don't review', but Iyer listens to his bowler. The ball has pitched outside leg, so that's a review wasted
stays low! Length ball on middle, and the googly spins across Warner. He tries to back away and cut, but the ball goes under. Just past the outside of off stump
dispatched! Back of a length on off, but Bairstow stands tall to pull square. Smacked to the leg-side boundary
length ball, wide outside off, but Bairstow swings across the line. Slices the shot over mid-on, and after that, the ball races away for four
toe crusher! Yorker on middle, and YJB does well to get his toes out of the way and dig it away to the leg side
length ball on middle, and Bairstow allows the ball to come to him, before nonchalantly flicking over short fine leg! Take that
falls just short of mid-on! Length ball, on off, and Bairstow tries to drive this over mid-on. Sliced to Rabada at mid-on, but the ball falls just short
deft touch! Length ball on middle, going down leg, and Bairstow helps the ball along it's way for four
through everyone! Length ball on middle, turning into Warner and he backs away to pull. Ball goes under his bat, it sneaks past leg stump, and then goes between Pant's legs! No bounce once again
length ball on off, and tapped off the back foot to long on
length ball on middle, and he backs away to cut. Mistimed to cover point
full just outside off, and he skips down the ground, before chipping a drive over Axar's head
full on off, and turning down the leg side. Bairstow exposes his stumps to try and sweep, but misses
length ball on middle, and Bairstow comes down the ground. Can't get bat on ball, and the delivery hits his body. Rolls away to the leg side
length ball, just outside off, and he flat-bats a shot down to long on. Keeps strike
length ball on leg, and angling across Warner. Tapped with soft hands in front of cover, and Warner calls for a quick single
full, just outside off, and he creams a front-foot push through the covers! 148kph? No problem!
length ball, wide outside off, and he cuts square to cover point
stand and deliver! Brute force. Full, just outside off, but Bairstow clears his front leg before check-slogging over Rabada's head
edged past the keeper! Full on off, and Bairstow tries to guide this towards short third man, but the ball takes a thick-ish edge and flies to the third-man boundary
low full toss on off, and tapped down the ground to long on
full just outside off, and driven with the legbreak to mid-off
length ball, just outside off, and he skips down the wicket before tapping this to midwicket for a jogging single
length ball on middle, and skidding through. Tapped off the back foot to Tewatia
length ball on off, and he makes room before cutting to deep point

given! But Bairstow reviews. Yorker on leg, and the ball hits Bairstow's toe. Tewatia appeals, umpire raises his finger, but Bairstow is quick to review. Surely that's an inside-edge? Or so he feels. Replays suggest no edge but Bairstow looks certain he's hit the ball. Wry smile on his face as we wait for ball-tracking. And the ball is crashing into leg stump. Finally, Sunrisers lose their first wicket before the 100-run mark
full, just outside off, and he defends with a big stride forward
length ball on off, and he rocks back to tap this with soft hands to cover. Shankar calls for the single
length ball, just outside off, and guided off the back foot to point. Off the mark
offcutter, lands on middle, and defended off the back foot to mid-off
length ball angling across Warner, and he tries to ramp it over the keeper. Played to Sandeep at third man
length ball on leg stump, and Warner attempts a back-foot defense. Inside-edges the shot right onto his body
straight to mid off! Warner's first failure this tournament. Full on middle, and Warner looks to check-drive straight. But it's found Morris
length ball on middle, and defended off the back foot to the non-striker. Stopped by Sandeep diving to his left
length ball, outside off, and turning away. Punched off the back foot to deep point
full, outside off, and turning away. He lifts a cover drive to deep extra cover
full, wide outside off, and drilled to long off for a walking single
tossed up on middle, but the googly goes down the leg side. Hits Pandey's pads, but they don't bother appealing
length ball on off, and he backs away to cut this googly to deep point. Misfield from Rabada allows them to take the second run. Timeout
full on off stump, and he prods forward to block back to Morris
overpitched, wide outside off, and that's been cut away to point
slower ball, overpitched wide outside off, and drilled to cover for a single
length ball, wide outside off, and he throws his hands at this. Hammers a lofted drive over the fielder at cover
flat-batted over the bowler! Back of a length outside off, and he toe-ends a pull to long on. Nearly carries to Rabada at long on
slower ball, full on middle, and driven to mid-on
length at off stump, backs away and punches to sweeper cover
length on leg stump, punched aerially towards long-on off the back foot
length on off stump, leans in and drives with the turn to long-off
length at leg stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
length at off stump, opens the face on the drive to sweeper cover
length on middle stump, punched back down the pitch and the bowler misfields
length at off stump, driven uppishly to long-off
length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
full on off stump, leans in, drives to long-off
length ball skidding down leg, can't get bat on the flick
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
length on middle stump, punched down the pitch off the back foot
length on off stump, rooted in the crease as he pokes this back to the bowler
short of a length legcutter outside off, dragged to deep square with a pull
legcutter, down leg side, can't get bat on that
length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket's right
length on leg stump, clipped to deep square
length on leg stump, flicked uppishly to deep square
length and in at the body as he walks down on this. Looks to flick, gets it pitch side on the leg side off the high part of the bat

straight to deep square! Decides to take him on and makes decent connection, but it wasn't well placed. Short of a length at middle and leg, stays a bit on the front foot and whips at this to hit it straight to that fielder
length outside off, looks to drive, gets it to point off the thick outside edge
length just outside off, pokes at it and is beaten
length ball down leg side, gets low and uses the pace and angle to ramp this to the fine boundary
dropped at extra cover! Length ball at off stump, steps out, gets to the pitch and goes inside-out. Hits straight to Iyer who crouches and hurriedly grabs from under this
length at off, driven to long-off
length at off stump, pushed into the off side
length on off stump, punched back down the pitch
length on off stump, driven on the front foot to long-off

taken at extra cover! Welcome to the new DC universe, where easy chases don't exist. Short of a length and gripping in the pitch as he gets on the back foot for the cut. That's a single at sweeper on most pitches but here he's through the shot before the ball's arrived. It floats up and dips on Iyer who holds on low in front of his body
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, gets low and paddles it to long leg
length on middle stump, steps out and pushes on the rise to long-on
nicely tossed up outside off, leans in and drives on the rise. Iyer dives to his right at extra and parries this to long-off
googly at a length outside off, blocked on the front foot
oh lovely shot. Uses his reach and puts this sweep away. Length outside off, big stride, swept along the floor to the square leg boundary
short of a length at middle stump, gets back and pulls to deep midwicket

tossed up at a length outside off, a googly. Steps out and looks to flick. Gets a thick inside edge into the square leg region where it is Ishant's duty to sprint and keep it to one. He doesn't manage it

taken at deep midwicket. Googly, slow and dipping outside off - that's the way to do it on this pitch! Gets the front leg down the track and looks to slog-sweep. Can't get anywhere near enough connection. Rabada runs in and holds on
short of a length on leg stump, flicked down to fine leg
climbs past the outside edge. Proper Test match sequence there. Slammed in at a length, angled in, moving away off the pitch with some bounce
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
yorker length at leg stump, jammed down to long-on
length at leg stump, sweet timing on the flick but Morris sprints to his right at long-on and keeps it to one
length and in at leg stump. Wants to flick but that's slammed the bat before he knows it. Rolls feebly into the leg side
short of a length and in at off stump, stays still in the crease, opens the face and runs this to point
inswinging yorker but he's managed to get an inside edge onto pad, and into the off side for a single
leading edge but safe! Full on leg stump, a nervous attempt at a flick and it lobs up safely to land in front of long-on
oh poor ball. Short and slanted down leg side. Nabi holds his poise and just runs his hands through this to get it fine
well bowled. Yorker dipping in at off stump. Jams it out to mid-off
past the edge. Bouncer at an off stump line. Backs away and slashes to try and get something on this. Is beaten by a long way
diving stop at mid-off and a crucial one from Iyer. Length ball in the corridor and it was nicely punched past extra cover
thick inside edge but it's four! Oh there is no justice as a bowler sometimes. Slower ball at a length on off stump, he backs away and wants to club it over mid-off. Gets it past midwicket
over the third man boundary and that's the game! Bounce in the corridor, backs away once more and swishes at it. This time he's managed to get bat on it and that seals the game
